intro: Thlaspi limosellifolium, commonly known as the watercress mustard, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its basal rosette of lance-shaped leaves and small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant thrives in moist, calcareous soils and is often found near streams and wetlands. It produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. Thlaspi limosellifolium is typically found in temperate regions and is considered a hardy, low-maintenance plant for wetland restoration projects.
